comments.body: Why are we leaving this log message here?
It's only for debugging, and in normal case on azure, these logs won't be printed since its log level is 10, only log level <=2 messages will be printed.

these two seems good.
`%v` has to handle a struct that contains a slice of string pointers here.

/cc @justaugustus 
/cc @kubernetes/sig-cloud-provider-pr-reviews
any reason why rename it? This rename causes lots of diffs.
There is already an existing package with name `compute`: "github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-go/arm/compute"

I think it will be easier to maintain if you get name of the function dynamically using reflections. For instance with [FuncForPC](https://golang.org/pkg/runtime/#FuncForPC) and [Example](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10742749/get-name-of-function-using-reflection-in-golang).
@cosmincojocar Considered reflection when preparing this PR. It could really help to simplify codes, but it also introductions performance penalty. I don't think we should use it much in production.
It wast just a suggestion. I totally agree that reflections might introduce a performance degradation.
@cosmincojocar thanks. Let's not depend on reflection now. We may revisit this when golang has evolved high-performance reflection.
